website_summaries.verdict: Basic model that can handle lightweight cameras. Desirable, low price tag for a monopod.
pros: Sections can extend up to 67" in length
Rubber coated foot won't skid, but can remove rubber to reveal metal spikes for grip outdoors
Nice cushion on the grip with a wrist strap
cons: Not made for use with heavy or large cameras

customer_reviews.title: Not To Be Trusted - May Destroy Your Gear!
customer_reviews.text: Image speaks for itself. The treads for mounting your camera quickly reduce from full to half circumference once inside the head. This means your 1, 3 or $10,000 camera is hanging from a very small amount of steel. Moreover - the steel is soft to where ti almost feels like pewter. When I noticed a little wiggle in the head I tightened the thread with moderate pressure and it snapped right off. Luckily I caught my camera mid air all ninja style. Until / unless they fix this - absolutely avoid
customer_reviews.author: Edwin S.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Broke first use when tightening.
customer_reviews.text: FIRST time using it, the metal mounting screw snapped off when fastening a camera to it. Cheap metal used to make the screw, and down where it connects it's only a half circle held in place by another half circle of plastic. That is the point where the metal screw broke. Not replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: I'd consider this a "light use" monopod.
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke within 10 days of purchase. I used it daily with a 70-200 + 5D mkii which weighs in about 6 lbs. I did carry the camera upside down, hanging from the monopod a few times while adjusting my position. The screw on top which connects the ball head broke off. Fortunately this happened while checking the head's tightness because it felt a little loosey-goosey. It just broke off in my hands. I USE my gear and if you do too, I'd look more closely at higher end units, with heavy weight ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke upon tightening on a quick release plate.
customer_reviews.text: Experienced the same problem the other reviewers did with the screw snapping off upon tightening a quick release plate to the monopod rendering the entire unit useless.This happened right before an event I needed to use it for. Very disappointing. If you're reading this amazon, please fix this by using higher quality steel for the screw! Everything else about the product seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: BE CAREFUL if you purchase this product!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product initially seemed very good for the price, but after the third use it broke. As I removed the monopod from my camera, the screw broke off and my camera almost fell to the ground. I will not re purchase this product, but I will seek out another monopod. Please be careful if you purchase this product. Not sure if this was just bad luck, poor product, or I may have just screwed it too tight to my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Beeswax, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: Very first use, screw broke inside our video camera. Reviews said it would hold cameras up to 6.6 lbs. Ours was just over 2 lbs. Screw just broke off clean in the bottom of our camera. BUYER BEWARE!! I've used AmazonBasics before and haven't had any issue, but from now on, I will probably just go with named brand. Just purchased a Manfrotto like our tripod--VERY reliable!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Brumley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect GoPro Selfie Stick/Pole
customer_reviews.text: Bought this amazon basics monopod to use as a go pro pole and it works perfectly. The rubber foot at the end can be removed and you can attach a 1/4-20 threaded rod so you can attach your go pro accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Mike CLT

customer_reviews.title: Another instance of pin fracture
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monopod a couple of years ago but didn't use it until a recent photoshoot in which I was using a long lens on my micro 4/3 camera. When swinging the monopod into the vertical position my camera and lens became free flying objects and only with extremely good luck was I able to catch the camera and lens in the crook of my arm. As many others have reported the pin was fractured exactly as pictured by some unhappy users. I almost never send Amazon reviews but decided to do this one to add weight to the warnings that this monopod is dangerous for use with serious photo gear.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Annis

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you're going to go hard with it. I tried using it as totem pole. Broke.
customer_reviews.text: Metal threads piece snapped just as others had indicated. It's not made for use if you're going to move a lot. Weak metal.
customer_reviews.author: Master Reed

customer_reviews.title: Good but with fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: The product is overall good, sturdy, easily transportable etc. The fatal flaw is the attachment screw that is used to attach a device (camera, binoculars etc.). It's too short and the screw itself is of poor quality. Second use and it snapped as I was tightening it. A shame. I ordered a different model/make today.
customer_reviews.author: Taylorisms

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a monopod/boom for my speedlite and came across this one. The reviews were good, so I ordered it over the rest of the higher priced name brand ones. I am very pleased with the purchase! It is light weight yet made of nicely crafted materials with the handle padded and the foot with a spike that you can screw to retract it. It extends to a nice distance so I can hang my light overhead. It comes with a nice carrying case and a shoulder strap too. Overall it is a nice pole that is exactly what I am looking for. When I need a second pole, I will get exactly the same one.
customer_reviews.author: LCStone

customer_reviews.title: I’m overall impressed
customer_reviews.text: There’s not much to say for such a simple device, but it’s well built and I can’t really see a monopod being any better unless you’re looking for a specific feature that this doesn’t have. It was heavier than I thought it would be, but not a problem unless you’re specifically looking for something as light as possible. It has a rubber foot on a ball joint that is very good for gripping the floor and has enough resistance to make holding the monopod at an angle much easier than if it just had a fixed foot. Overall, for the price it was better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic basic grade monopod
customer_reviews.text: The price on this is so reasonable you might as well give it a try. I love using a monopod, it improves my shot choice and framing, not to mention stability. This stick is light and compact extending to a completely adequate length. I have a ball head and quick release so it is like having a tripod. I use several cameras and all have a a quick release and can be on this stick in seconds. For my bigger cameras it fights fatigue and increases stability. It gives me a moment to reconsider settings and shot.
customer_reviews.author: ImMrBill3

customer_reviews.title: Wish I purchased one of these sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I love the portability and versatility of this monopod. I love the height adjustment, stability and durability. It's paid for itself already - used at 2 graduations and one wedding in just 2 months of use; couldn't be happier. The locking adjusters are strong, everything is really well made and lightweight. I'm confident attaching my Lumix Super-Zoom to this and love that I can just plant and shoot. This really helps with stability and I can see a huge improvement in my photos sharpness/focus and more level. I took a chance on this Amazon "basic" product and really glad I did. So far, extremely pleased, can't wait to take it on vacation with me later this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Big Sky Dreams

customer_reviews.title: Threads Stripped on Screw after 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: Initially loved this item for sturdiness and price. Unfortunately after limited use (15-20 times in 3 months) the threads on the camera mounting screw wore off? and will no longer thread into the camera socket, however my old reliable tripod does. Just a cheap Chinese screw and cannot be replaced. DON'T BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mcflyfish

customer_reviews.title: My first monopod! Its great.
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with this durability of this monopod. I was looking for one to video my son at soccer matches and was tired of manually holding my phone up. This was a perfect solution. I just had to purchase a mount for my phone, but it then screwed to the top of the monopod. I could easily just twist my hand to rotate the field of view for recording. Held up well over 3 days of games (approx 10 hours worth of use). I don't see any signs of this breaking or wearing out.
customer_reviews.author: benducklow

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these for my son and I to share. Ended up buying another one because we liked it so much. We like to hike, birdwatch, and photograph birds. This monopod is a great alternative to a tripod when we are hiking and don’t want to bring a tripod (obviously tripods are necessary in some instances). Bonus is that the monopod is very sturdy and doubles as a walking stick. Retracts very easily for storage. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but grip is worthless
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and sturdy but get something better if you want to use on hikes or even neighborhood walks. I can’t even fit my hand through the grip. Expect Amazon to think these things through better... I’ll keep, but only because my camera store is on coronavirus lockdown.
customer_reviews.author: Fixed Gear Tom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for quick stabilization shots...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son and girlfriend to be used with their Panasonic Lumix GX85 cameras. They took them along when we drove to the top of Mt Washington in NH this past week where we experiences 40-50MPH wind gusts. My son was glad to have the stick to use with his camera to stabilize his shots against the wind..... Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but mold growing on the case!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product today and upon oping the box I discovered mold growing on the case. I quickly threw it back in the big box that it came in and grabbed my gloves and face mask. After that I opened the case and saw that the monopod was wrapped in a plastic bag. I wiped down the product with a Clorox wipe. the monopod is of good quality and is pretty lightweight. when i put in some good hours with it i will update the review however i will not be giving it any higher rating due to the mold on the case issue unless they rectify the problem.
customer_reviews.author: J03Y

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted EXCEPT the screw is cheap and immediately stripped
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the monopod, it worked great. The second time, when I screwed it into the base of my camera, I barely tightened it, and it popped off. From there on, I couldn't screw it on because it had stripped. The screw is a super-cheap, soft metal. Rather than send it back, I replaced the screw with a better one and now it works great (the photo is of the new screw). So... only buy this if you're okay with replacing the screw with a sturdier one (it's not hard). Otherwise, I'd pass.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Kosloski

customer_reviews.title: Nice for about 1 years usage, then I repurchase the same item.
customer_reviews.text: I like the monopod and it's relatively cheap, but it seems like the bottom third gives way and starts to slide after about a year of usage. I take sports photography about 4 days a week for roughly 10 months of the year, so it gets its usage, I just hate to have to replace it every year. That being said, I do buy it again when it gives out since it is handy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Erin OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Combination walking stick and support pole for camera, phone and binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: Whoever invented and makes this deserves an award. For the price it is fabulous for use with my movie camera, camera, phone camera (with device made to hold phone and attach to standard tripod or monopod), and binoculars (with wrapping device for binoculars that has female threaded hole to attach to top of pole). I have poor balance and wanted and needed something for our upcoming Alaska cruise. So I bought two for dual use as walking sticks and to support my binoculars and my cameras while on this nature trip.Again Amazon had the solution to my balance problem to allow me to enjoy life more.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Brachman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy; Your Gear Will Suffer
customer_reviews.text: My yearbook students used this twice to photograph a football game. It was mounted to a very expensive telephoto lens, and the mounting screw broke off inside the lens thread. Not cool. This is junk.
customer_reviews.author: acrididae

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT  trust your camera on this garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap crap, not worth the trouble. The threaded screw snapped off on my VERY FIRST time using it. The screw wasn't even tight either, and almost no pressure at all made the cheap plastic surrounding snap like a twig. Glad I had a firm grip on my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bad movie guy

customer_reviews.title: the locking toggles take a firm grip
customer_reviews.text: Built like a BRICK S*** H****! LOVE it! Comes with a protective storage bag. haslanyardto help you carry. not neede, but nice It also has an adjustable foot-A sharp point,or spin the food around to cover the point with a semi soft rubber foot to avoid marring floors. a good product!
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Decent hiking monopod
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this like a trekking pole while hiking, with a camcorder attached. So far, it has stood up on rocky terrain and muddy terrain, remained stable and does the job. Not the lightest trekking monopod, but one of the tallest!
customer_reviews.author: Slone

customer_reviews.title: Love this Monopod
customer_reviews.text: Love this Monopod !! Never knew I could find so many uses for it besides the original purpose !! I've used it to take photos from below looking upward using the timer and have used it as an extension to shoot in holes/nests in trees above ground with the timer !! Your imagination is your only limit !! I have even used it upside down so I don't have to lay on ground to get level shots of my subject !! It is well made and well designed for what you pay for it !!
customer_reviews.author: FLG

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This monopod is a godsend. My upper body strength is lacking, and when I have my telephoto lens on my camera, I get a lot of camera blur unless my arms are being supported. With this, I don't have the blur. It's also easier for me to use than a tripod at times because I only have to deal with one clip. It is not good for low light situations as obviously, it's a monopod and it's hard to keep it still, but it will work in other siutations where you need to hold the camera up for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Kay

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monopod. It isn't as steady as a tripod, but there is less wind vibration than I get with a regular tripod because my hands are holding the camera; so it does have its benefits besides just ease of carrying. On many days in Texas, I can't take long distance pictures with a tripod due to the wind, but I can with this monopod. I just have a little trouble keeping the camera focused on the subject. Bracing myself against something helps tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Big Steve from Seymour (by Gawd) Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight monopod.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a wedding on an island where I was going to need to run (on foot) from venue to venue so I needed something light but sturdy. This fit the bill and performed excellent. I would suggest a decent ball head for it, I bought a cheap one and ended up discarding it and just putting my camera directly in this monopod. Very impressed with how good it worked out for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helping me take photo's
customer_reviews.text: Im getting up in age loosing my stability when taking picture's. This product is allowing me to take clearly focused photos again.
customer_reviews.author: Profiler

customer_reviews.title: Pretty flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and not very robust. Top has come loose so it is a bit unstable. Probably acceptable for a small camera or camcorder, but definitely not built for long lenses or continuous use. I would recommend spending a bit more money and getting something sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: George H. Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: A great help
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this prior to a trip where I anticipated shooting a lot of nature and wildlife photos. This was a great help, and allowed me to capture some wonderful things. I am a wheelchair user, so a full tripod is heavy and cumbersome, but this family lightweight collapsible monopod was easy to carry and set up. Am so glad I purchased it
customer_reviews.author: Marsh Hen

customer_reviews.title: ... AmazonBasics product and once again I have not been disappointed. I call myself an intermediate level photographer and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first AmazonBasics product and once again I have not been disappointed. I call myself an intermediate level photographer and this fits my needs very well. Product certainly is not a Manfrotti but it also didn't cost as much. It is solid, Legs slide easily and height is easily adjustable for this 6 foot tall photographer. Only negative is that the metal spike in the foot does not retract all the way into the rubber foot that is used on floors. Problem was resolved by super glue and a 3/16" rubber washer. For the money it will do everything I nedd it to do.
customer_reviews.author: BDAWG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect walking stick
customer_reviews.text: MAKES A PERFECT WALKING STICK! For big n tall people like myself because it's very long & can be adjusted shorter if need be. But half the time I felt like I was in munchkin land and needed something longer
customer_reviews.author: Charles Loftin

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, portable and well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in a theater type environment to video my granddaughters vocal recital without being as intrusive as with a bulky, awkward tripod. I was able to easily hold my Canon DSLR steady for the entire recital and did not interfere with anyone else's view or space. I will probably give it to her now along with the new tripod I bought her for her new Canon DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but NOT flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Good monopod that is not flimsy. Inexpensive and very basic but that is just what I wanted. Don't really care for the wrist strap at the top but it fits my video camera and is easy enough to collapse and pack up in seconds. Grip should hold up for quite a while and is comfortable. The only thing I think that I might add is an adjustable elbow at the top so I can shoot different angles while holding it like a selfie stick or just needing a bit more reach. I shoot football games and band performances as a hobby and this fits the bill. Would recommend and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional photographer, but I do have several cameras and this thing works great with all of them, even my cumbersome Canon 60D. This monopod extends to be almost taller than me but collapses to a very compact size. It also comes with a nifty zippered nylon carrying case with a shoulder strap. It's well-built, solid and can be extended to any height within its range easily. The bottom can either be a rubber, non-slip foot or (with just a few turns) it can be turned into a metal spike for use on dirt, grass or sand. Seriously, unless you're a professional who needs some super high-end features, spend the 20 bucks and get this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to love this, but it didn't work that well for me. I actually removed the crank and elevate top part of a broken tripod and had a camera on a short stick this way. I could brace the stick many ways against my body and it worked better than this did.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth King

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what you would expect at this price point. A good value monopod.
customer_reviews.text: This was worth every penny. Not a lot more. A decent monopod or even a walking stick. I used it with my phone gimball to make a camera crane. It was awesome for that.
customer_reviews.author: Anneliese

customer_reviews.title: As others have noted, the screw threading for mounting ...
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the screw threading for mounting your camera, or in my case binoculars is low quality. The threads on this monopod either broke on my first use or were never the proper size for the 'universal 1/4" '. A completely worthless monopod.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Syrett

customer_reviews.title: Well made, inexpensive, light weight, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to photograph eagles from a pontoon boat. There was very little room for a regular tripod and the 500mm lens on my camera is heavy. That being said, this little monopod was perfect for the adventure. It is light, easy to set up and very stable. It is easy to shorten and lengthen. Considering how little it cost it is a no-brain bargain.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a baton. This isn't a baton and it shouldn't be labeled as such.
customer_reviews.author: Darrel Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Good for light wieght cameras, gopro etc.. 1/4" on top is too short wasn't long enough to attach a couple other action cams I have. They should make it adjustable so you can choose length and tighten according.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Don’t BUY THIS TRASH!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trash and the first time I attempted to use it, I connected it to my 400mm lens mount and noticed it still had play in it. When I tried to hand tighten it some more it snapped in half! I then noticed the bolt was already cut in half! It was a total ripoff!
customer_reviews.author: S L Parker, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Fair quality monopod
customer_reviews.text: Fair quality and does the job. The grip is good and the latches for the extension work well, but it would be nicer if it could shrink up further than it does, or if the case was slightly larger. No room to add a ball mount if you wanted to make this far more useful. The pointed base works well and it is a good weight. I wouldn't use this with a particularly large lens. Works well with a vintage 200mm Mamiya lens on a Nikon D3200 body, but I wouldn't want anything heavier than that.
customer_reviews.author: @A_Random_BlokeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great product, inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it should. Convenient and the case has a nice adjustable strap. Doesn’t really fit that well in a regular backpack but straps easily to the side. I run the buckle straps of my bag through the strap on the case so it can’t fall off. Way way better than a selfie stick for live streaming. My friend has been using the same one for years and recommended it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is excellent for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is light and very versatile. It provides a useful walking stick and is an excellent alternative to lugging around a tripod. It can stabilize your camera and works particularly well when braced against a wall or a rock. The only improvement would be a cover for the screw thread when the monopod is being used as a walking stick.
customer_reviews.author: Philip T.

customer_reviews.title: A handy stick
customer_reviews.text: I use this a good bit when I go walking in the local woodland garden. It not only helps me steady my camera, but doubles as a walking stick. It's sturdy enough, lightweight, and does what it's supposed to do. I have not figured out how to put the straps for both the monopod and the camera on my wrist, but so far, I haven't dropped either of them. YAY!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Henley Babb

customer_reviews.title: Price is right and does the job good design
customer_reviews.text: To steady my camera has performed very well on my first outing at a sports event. Steady's the the camera and the natural body shacking is limited.Using my telephoto lens is a breeze. Steady your shots better pictures. Will review more at another time using it at other events. Brand new and receive in within the specify time.
customer_reviews.author: rkwsr

customer_reviews.title: Eh, so so as a monopod
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind I tried using this with a Canon 6D body with a 100-400 lens. Honestly this monopod makes an awesome hiking stick. It just isn’t stable enough for my heavy gear. I do love it as my official hiking stick though. Lightweight and it’ll collapse for easy storage
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my Olympus dslr camera, and love it so far! I have a lot of trust in Amazon basics products, and they have yet to let me down. This monopod is 67 inches (way taller than me). It has three separate latches that you can adjust for whatever length you need it to be, and has a padded handle and wrist strap. Amazon basics usually provides a carrying case for products like these which is a huge plus, while other companies may not. This will fit pretty much any type of camera, and is overall a great quality item for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Miller

customer_reviews.title: A+ on this one, Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: You could easily spend $100 on an expensive monopod that is meant to fold to half the length or that has carbon fiber sections to it. For someone like me who doesn't shoot pro any more and just needs something to use once in a blue moon, you honestly can't beat it for $15. I use it with a Canon 6D and a 300mm f/4L and a 70-200mm f/4L and it has no issues handling the weight. Sure, it's not tiny, but it's way smaller and a fraction of the weight of my Manfrotto tripod. A+ on this one, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer Pro

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you like your camera
customer_reviews.text: Sucks!!! Broke my A6500 and Sigma 16mm 1.4 because the head snapped off, piece of junk don’t buy if you like your camera.
customer_reviews.author: JCCrater

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This is lightweight, opens easily and quickly by moving a piece that keeps each segment tight (that is, you don't have to waste time screwing or unscrewing a tightening nut), is sturdy, and has a rubber foot that can be changed to a short spike depending on the ground surface. It's a real bargain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett E. WernerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It just sort of works
customer_reviews.text: If the screw end works, the telescoping works and is stable, and the foot grips a little, how else could you go wrong with a stick for a camera? They all do, and this product is a great buy for what it does, adding stability and taking the load off your arm when used in prolonged shooting situations.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Allred

customer_reviews.title: Nice mono pod for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have another one that is almost exactly the same but a different color so I expected this on would be just as nice. I wasn't disappointed. Sturdy and light weight, heck you can use it as a walking stick until you are ready to put your camera on and use it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lafollette

customer_reviews.title: Light, sturdy, inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for one specific shoot where I knew I would be on sand and in the ocean. I didn't want the additional weight and bulkiness of a tripod and I didn't want to spend a lot since I knew the harsh conditions I was working in would likely ruin whatever I was using. This monopod was the perfect choice. I breaks down to a very compact size and extends to whatever height you need very quickly. The locks did their job so well I even found myself using this to support myself when trying to navigate very rocky shoreline. What more could you ask for in a monopod?
customer_reviews.author: TX BBQ Boss

customer_reviews.title: Quality gear at a entry level price.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first monopod I have ever owned. I purchased this one based on reviews here at Amazon and have not been disapointed. I looked a couple of different models in this price range at local stores. Nothing I looked at came close to the features and quality of this one at the same price. This monopod is very well made, materials seem to be quality and I believe it will definitely hold up over time. I have had no problems at all with it so far after about three months of use. I would highly recommend this product to anyone looking to add a great piece of gear to there setup.
customer_reviews.author: Semper-Fi

customer_reviews.title: nice monopod/walking stick
customer_reviews.text: Use this all the time now as a walking stick that can quickly take my large camera lens for quick stabilization. Came with a nice case which I strap on the outside of my camera "suitcase" for traveling. The foam hand grip, however, is a bit too big and takes getting used to. It also slips down but a spot of glue fixed that. Would be 5-star if this grip were better.
customer_reviews.author: Clint C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing :)
customer_reviews.text: Finally a monopod easy to maneuver, sturdy clips, great material, light weight, can use for sports camera or hiking
customer_reviews.author: Luciana F Marques

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: My old one bit the dust and was more expensive. It only lasted 2 soccer seasons. This one has lasted 4. Good quality and the case helps protect it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Pugh

customer_reviews.title: A great value-priced Monopod.  Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic and functional monopod that I use for my Canon EOS Rebel T3 and it absolutely does the trick. The handle (which is made of foam) is comfortable and makes for an easy grip and steadying the camera for the right shot. The extendible sections on the leg make this functional and easy to use. It also comes with a sturdy nylon carry case that has a shoulder strap and a good zipper. For the price point, I am very happy with it. I know Amazon stands behind their "AmazonBasics" brand. So far, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Diana de Avila

customer_reviews.title: Great Monopod
customer_reviews.text: This monopod is very useful in areas where you can't fit a tripod. It's very easy to balance and collapsible which is great for storage. It's high-quality and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Should've read the reviews screw broke after 1 use. Cheap do not buy. I would return it but i threw it out very disgusted with the quality
customer_reviews.author: jorge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Monopod at this price
customer_reviews.text: I have a $150+ Manfrotto monopod and no, this isn't that. But, for what this is, it is fantastic. I often put a softbox on a monopod and have an assistant hold it. This thing is perfect for that situation. I've used my DSLR on it as well with a Manfrotto ball head. It does just fine. Like I said it doesn't have the same feel as a more expensive monopod but, at the same time, I've hit a point where these things are pretty disposable. And, this is a lot easier to swallow than $150+.
customer_reviews.author: Blayne A.

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the Price.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Its so cheap i bought 2, 1 for general purpose and I keep one in my car just In case I'm ever out and want to stop and take a quick picture and need some form of stability. I have even used it as a Cheap boom pole before in pinch. Zoom H! screws right ontop of it, Or if you buy a thread adapter you can put the Rode Video MicGo ontop of it.
customer_reviews.author: NerdyNickNacks

customer_reviews.title: No more tired arm shaky camera footage
customer_reviews.text: No more tired arm shaky camera footage. This thing makes recording with heavy DSLR cameras a breeze. You can even by can attachment for your phone. Feels solid and sturdy and have very good length, if you need it. I'm almost 6' and haven't need to extend it to its full length. And at this price? Why not?
customer_reviews.author: Raymond G

customer_reviews.title: Monopod ?
customer_reviews.text: This is a selfie stick. It does not have feet, so it will not stand on it's own. Not to be used with 360 cameras. Maybe I did not know what I was getting.
customer_reviews.author: GfromD

customer_reviews.title: Great product, low price..
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what to say about this item... It is just fantastic. I love how easy this mono pod is to use. The latch style locking system is fast and efficient. The all black construction matches the rest of my gear. I mean it is perfect for general use. While shooting one day, another photographer asked me where I purchased it. She said she liked the simplicity of it and that it was all black. I had to tell her it was an AmazonBasics product! She couldn't believe it. This is a great value purchase. Especially for somebody who wants a great product at a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Metz

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I'm a casual "dad" photographer mostly youth sports, and for the money this is a great deal. Nothing fancy and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dawna Williamson

customer_reviews.title: A good solid monopod for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for over 2 years now. Been used for HOURS at a time at horse shows and it is still going strong. Is it a Manfrotto? No. But if you expect Amazon Basics to be a $75 monopod, you sir/maam are a moron. If you expect mid range quality for a mid range price, THAT IS WHAT YOU WILL GET. Don't trust it to hold 400lbs. But yes, this monopod will support a good bit of weight for you for a good long while (years) without failing you.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Jarman

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device. It's good as a hiking stick with the top two sections extended and great for such things as eagle's nests with the third section extended. Others have mentioned a breakage problem with the mounting screw for the camera, but I wonder if they might have over tightened the camera or, worse yet, used it as a hiking stick with the camera mounted on it. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Tire Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Love this monopod!!
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, it's a monopod. Exceptional value for the dollar! Very nice stability even with heaver cameras and/or with long lenses. Lightweight and compact which makes it so simple to take into the field. I'd buy it again and would strongly recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at a great price. I bought this for my new Canon SX60 HS which has an enormous zoom capability. I used it for the first time yesterday and it really helped to make it much easier to stabilize the camera at full 65x zoom. A friend of mine saw me use this Monopod yesterday and asked where I bought it and how much did it cost. I gave him the info and he ordered the same Monopd from Amazon today. Thanks for offering such a great product
customer_reviews.author: Razduck

customer_reviews.title: No idea why i didnt buy sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Worth every penny. I can't believe how much I use this even though I'm pretty steady. Add a handle attachment and you have a winning combination. Couldn't recommend it more. Plus all AMAZON BASIC products are awesome. I look folirst to see if Amazon has a product available in their "Basics" line before buying anything else. 9 imws out if 10, I buy Amazon's. Buy it...buy 2. You'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: BlueEyedMediaDotCom

customer_reviews.title: recommend
customer_reviews.text: was pleasantly surprised that this helped with a photography project I was working on. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: such a fan

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for full size cameras.
customer_reviews.text: Like many others the mounting screw sheared of it appears the lower section of the threaded shaft is half the diameter. Seems almost like it is designed to breakaway but I can’t fathom a reason to do that. I only use it with GoPros and small 360° cameras. Now that I’m aware of the construction I would never attach a full DSLR to it. At 2 for $22 I’ll probably buy another set. Right now I’m happy with my work around. Only took a mild snag on a tree branch to shear off the mount.
customer_reviews.author: DVD Dan

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use and compact size for travel.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this monostick . It was easy to use and took the worry out of trying to hold my camera steady while using the telephoto lense! I got great pictures to prove it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: For the money this was great deal. It work well as a lightweight steady up for my Pentax K-1MKII and for the occasional in the field photographer. It would not be my choice if I had to use every day, would want something a bit more built to handle hard use. Having said that, it has been nice and easy to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Buhlmann

customer_reviews.title: Mono-lock?
customer_reviews.text: Using this monopod as patio sliding door "lock". See the photo. It's adjustable, sturdy, and unobtrusive. Beats using a piece of wood. The included carrying bag is a nice bonus. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: KarlWS

customer_reviews.title: and still strong enough to provide better stability for your shooting needs
customer_reviews.text: I've had similar versions of this exact model but sold under different names, so I already knew the quality of this product going in. I will say the clamps seem to be stronger than other budget monopods in this price range which is a bonus. It's light weight, folds up small and compact, and still strong enough to provide better stability for your shooting needs.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Morgan (DVZN Media)

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son with a new I pad for school. At first he didn’t really want it , but know he says he’s glad he has it and uses it all the time. It took a little longer to ship then the iPad because it’s coming from Korea.... but it’s all good and works well. No problems
customer_reviews.author: Amy Blissett

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monopod to use with my Smooth 4 gimbal to extend its reach. It is sturdy and light weight. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Works fine! This is my first monopod, so nothing to compare to? I used it with my Nikon D7500 and 70-200 F2.8 Nikon lens for shooting runners at various races. Sturdy, locks do not slip, easy to adjust, case is fine, etc!
customer_reviews.author: Edward G.

customer_reviews.title: It Works Well
customer_reviews.text: It's an expandable stick....what can I say about that?? It helps keep a camera steady.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck, Cherry Hill, NJ

customer_reviews.title: Bouldering stick-brush!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to see how it would work as a stick-brush for bouldering. Man, I would've never expected it would work so well. I just removed the attachment on the skinnier end and mounted a brush to it. This thing is really sturdy and I'm thoroughly glad that I made the purchase. No doubt it will work well as a monopod also ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the right tool for macro
customer_reviews.text: Its a monopod, does exactly what it is designed to do. Very lightweight and I can extend and collapse it quickly. Took it out for a test today, I shoot nature macro and I was surprised by how efficiently it handled. Comfy grip up top and a tip on the bottom for steady support. Just what I needed. I have never used another monopod but not sure why anyone would pay more for one when this guy is all you will need.
customer_reviews.author: Marv

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easy affordable
customer_reviews.text: Thumbs up. Easy to use. The only thing I would caution you about is to not have an illusion that this is lightweight it’s it’s relatively lightweight but not
customer_reviews.author: CuriousGeorge

customer_reviews.title: much higher quality than expected.
customer_reviews.text: very good quality, much thicker and heavier than I expected. Great value for the price. I like a monopod way better than tripod for the quick adjustments you can make, and easy movement around the beach, where i use it. The carry bag is great and has a nice quality zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii T

customer_reviews.title: Keep you camera steady
customer_reviews.text: I always noticed that professional photographers at sporting events have monopods. I wanted to try one and this one was inexpensive. This was a great purchase. It keeps the camera steady but keeps the portable. I should have bought a monopod years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and light
customer_reviews.text: Not only is it great for photo walks and events that cover a lot of square footage, but I found that it's just as handy for holding off-camera flashes. I haven[t had any issues with build quality or reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Ted80pTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Rod
customer_reviews.text: It is strong and ridged, and very light. It has exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.author: M. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Price is great, what can you say about that but I ...
customer_reviews.text: Price is great, what can you say about that but I bought this to mount a Canon M3 to take elevated shots at receptions and the monopd is a little too flimsy with this camera and a speedlite. I would buy it again though, I purchased a much more expensive monopod and ball head before and it got swiped at a wedding the first time I used it! For less than 30 bucks I will use this mononpod and the DMKFoto Heavy Duty Ball Head.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Bookman

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and telescoping.
customer_reviews.text: Also this device can be used for Walking 🚶‍♂️ cane and Bat knocker for self defense.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Cosmo 🐣

customer_reviews.title: Great monopod for simple needs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this monopod so I could do some simple video from a DSLR camera without tilting the camera with my hands. It's great for the purpose I needed though it may not be enough for super professional work.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Kemp

customer_reviews.title: I love the Monopod
customer_reviews.text: I use the monopod with my cell phone so that I do not have to stand holding the phone up for 15 or more minutes. I love it. It comes with a case which is good and very easy to adjust on the fly without too much shaking while recording.
customer_reviews.author: Nwn4media

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice monopod. Just what I need to steady this 900 mm beast
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ballantyne

customer_reviews.title: Nice, light monopod
customer_reviews.text: An overview of the monopod. I show some of the features of the item and some close up views. This is a nice light weight monopod, easy to pack and does not take up much space. I am a recreational picture taker and I did not need a professional grade item. I think this monopod is well made and is worth the price. It will suit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics 67-Inch Monopod
feature_bullets: Supports video cameras, still cameras, and scopes up to 6.6 lbs.
Four leg sections able to extend 67-inches
Non-skid rubber foot and retractable spikes
Built in cushion grip and adjustable wrist strap
Made of lightweight aluminum weighing less than 1 lb
Product Dimension: 1.7 x 1.6 x 21.4 inches (LxWxH); 15.7 ounces

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,427 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
